headline.print_headline: China President Urges 'Decisive Actions' After Xinjiang Attack
headline.main: China President Urges 'Decisive Actions' After Xinjiang Attack

docs.snippet: Chinese President Xi Jinping urged "decisive actions" against "terrorists" after an attack at a train station in the restive far western region of Xinjiang killed three people, state news agency Xinhua said on Thursday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Chinese President Xi Jinping urged "decisive actions" against "terrorists" after an attack at a train station in the restive far western region of Xinjiang killed three people, state news agency Xinhua said on Thursday.

headline.print_headline: Putin, Cameron Agree 'Peaceful Means' Only Way Out of Ukraine Crisis: Kremlin
headline.main: Putin, Cameron Agree 'Peaceful Means' Only Way Out of Ukraine Crisis: Kremlin

docs.snippet: Russia's President Vladimir Putin and British Prime Minister David Cameron, in a phone call on Wednesday, agreed the Ukrainian crisis can only be solved through "peaceful means", the Kremlin said in a statement....
docs.lead_paragraph: Russia's President Vladimir Putin and British Prime Minister David Cameron, in a phone call on Wednesday, agreed the Ukrainian crisis can only be solved through "peaceful means", the Kremlin said in a statement.

headline.print_headline: ArcelorMittal, Bekaert Swap Stakes in Latin America Wire Ventures
headline.main: ArcelorMittal, Bekaert Swap Stakes in Latin America Wire Ventures

docs.snippet: ArcelorMittal SA, the world's largest steelmaker, and Bekaert Group on Wednesday agreed to swap their stakes in their Brazil, Costa Rica and Ecuador ventures, part of a broader plan to extend a four-decade partnership in fast-growing markets, an e...
docs.lead_paragraph: ArcelorMittal SA, the world's largest steelmaker, and Bekaert Group on Wednesday agreed to swap their stakes in their Brazil, Costa Rica and Ecuador ventures, part of a broader plan to extend a four-decade partnership in fast-growing markets, an executive said.

headline.print_headline: EU Peacekeepers Take Charge at Central African Republic Airport, Violence Rages
headline.main: EU Peacekeepers Take Charge at Central African Republic Airport, Violence Rages

docs.snippet: European Union peacekeepers took charge of security at Central African Republic's main airport on Wednesday in their first major operation to try and end months of sectarian slaughter....
docs.lead_paragraph: European Union peacekeepers took charge of security at Central African Republic's main airport on Wednesday in their first major operation to try and end months of sectarian slaughter.

docs.abstract: The conductor and pianist Daniel Barenboim, in partnership with Universal Music, creates a digital label.

headline.print_headline: From Music to Nudity, Venezuela Protesters Get Creative
headline.main: From Music to Nudity, Venezuela Protesters Get Creative

docs.snippet: Venezuelan students are putting mock gravestones in the streets, setting up "resistance" camps and even stripping off in a plethora of new tactics to counter dwindling support for a three-month protest movement against President Nicolas Maduro....
docs.lead_paragraph: Venezuelan students are putting mock gravestones in the streets, setting up "resistance" camps and even stripping off in a plethora of new tactics to counter dwindling support for a three-month protest movement against President Nicolas Maduro.

headline.print_headline: Traders Keep Bets on July 2015 for First Fed Rate Hike
headline.main: Traders Keep Bets on July 2015 for First Fed Rate Hike

docs.snippet: U.S. short-term interest-rate futures contracts were little changed on Wednesday after the Federal Reserve said it will continue to wind down its bond-buying program, with traders keeping in place their bets the Fed will wait until July 2015 befor...
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. short-term interest-rate futures contracts were little changed on Wednesday after the Federal Reserve said it will continue to wind down its bond-buying program, with traders keeping in place their bets the Fed will wait until July 2015 before raising rates.

headline.print_headline: Second New Mexico Football Player Arrested in Student's Rape
headline.main: Second New Mexico Football Player Arrested in Student's Rape

docs.snippet: A second University of New Mexico football player has been arrested on suspicion of raping and kidnapping a fellow student earlier this month, officials said on Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A second University of New Mexico football player has been arrested on suspicion of raping and kidnapping a fellow student earlier this month, officials said on Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: Patience Key to Valencia's Comeback Chances, Says Pizzi
headline.main: Patience Key to Valencia's Comeback Chances, Says Pizzi

docs.snippet: Patience and intensity will be crucial if Valencia are to overturn a 2-0 deficit in Thursday's Europa League semi-final, second leg at home to La Liga rivals Sevilla, coach Juan Antonio Pizzi said....
docs.lead_paragraph: Patience and intensity will be crucial if Valencia are to overturn a 2-0 deficit in Thursday's Europa League semi-final, second leg at home to La Liga rivals Sevilla, coach Juan Antonio Pizzi said.

headline.print_headline: Russia Voices Concern Over 'Militaristic Statements' From Kiev
headline.main: Russia Voices Concern Over 'Militaristic Statements' From Kiev

docs.snippet: The Russian Foreign Ministry expressed concern on Wednesday about "militaristic statements" from Kiev after acting President Oleksander Turchinov said Ukraine's armed forces were on full military alert in case of a Russian invasion....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Russian Foreign Ministry expressed concern on Wednesday about "militaristic statements" from Kiev after acting President Oleksander Turchinov said Ukraine's armed forces were on full military alert in case of a Russian invasion.
